1:
Not to us, Yahweh, not to us,\q but to your name bring honor,
\q for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness.
\q
2:
Why should the nations say,\q "Where is their God?"


\q
3:
Our God is in heaven;\q he does whatever he pleases.
\q
4:
The nations' idols are silver and gold,\q the work of men's hands.


\q
5:
Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak;\q they have eyes, but they do not see;
\q
6:
they have ears, but they do not hear;\q they have noses, but they do not smell.


\q
8:
Those who make them are like them,\q as is everyone who trusts in them.


\q
9:
Israel, trust in Yahweh;\q he is your help and shield.
\q
10:
House of Aaron, trust in Yahweh;\q he is your help and shield.
\q
11:
You who honor Yahweh, trust in him;\q he is your help and shield.


\q
13:
He will bless those who honor him,\q both young and old.
\q
14:
May Yahweh increase your numbers more and more,\q yours and your descendants'.


\q
15:
May you be blessed by Yahweh,\q who made heaven and earth.
\q
16:
The heavens belong to Yahweh;\q but the earth he has given to mankind.


\q
17:
The dead do not praise Yahweh,\q nor do any who go down into silence;
\q
18:
But we will bless Yahweh\q now and forevermore.
\q Praise Yahweh.
